thread.title: Manchester United should forget about signing Gareth Bale according to club legend Ryan Giggs
thread.title_full: Manchester United should forget about signing Gareth Bale according to club legend Ryan Giggs

author: rforrester
title: Manchester United should forget about signing Gareth Bale according to club legend Ryan Giggs
text:
Bale of stay Manchester United should forget about signing Gareth Bale according to club legend Ryan Giggs 
Welsh wizard returned from an 88 day spell on the sidelines to score in Madrid's 2-0 win over Espanyol By Richard Forrester Comments RYAN GIGGS admits he doesn’t see Real Madrid star Gareth Bale leaving the Bernabeu anytime soon. 3 Gareth Bale is not leaving Real Madrid anytime soon according to Ryan Giggs 
Bale left Tottenham for Madrid in a stunning £85million world-record deal in September 2013 and has lived up to his price-tag. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Football news, gossip, transfers and goals 
But any hope of a Premier League return looks slim according to Giggs. 
Speaking to BBC Wales Sport , he said: “He looks happy at Real Madrid. I don’t think he’s going anywhere at the moment. 
“From a fan’s point of view, it would be great to see him back in the Premier League. 
“The United fans would love to see him at Old Trafford. You talk about the big clubs and United is up there. Getty Images Gareth Bale netted just 12 minutes into his return from a long layoff related articles Theo Walcott signs Sutton players' shirts in dressing room after Arsenal's routine FA Cup victory He offers mour than roo Jose Mourinho promises Marcus Rashford game time - is it the end for Wayne Rooney? Croktober fest Liverpool defender Dejan Lovren has flown to Germany for treatment on recurring knee injury Five things we learnt Sutton 0 Arsenal 2: Theo Walcott scored his 100th goal to remind Arsene Wenger of scoring prowess DREAM TEAM RATINGS Sutton United v Arsenal: See who shone as the part-timers made Gunners work hard for victory Scotten luck Scott Hogan's season in doubt after Aston Villa's £12m deadline day signing is stretchered off at Newcastle He Shaw is hungry Sutton back-up keeper Wayne Shaw gives fans a laugh as he's caught chomping down on a pie Lanslide for Toon Newcastle 2 Aston Villa 0: Yoan Gouffran and Henri Lansbury own-goal move Magpies back to the top of the Championship HEADS HELD HIGH Sutton 0 Arsenal 2: United's magical FA Cup run ends as Theo Walcott bags his 100th club goal in gritty encounter FA Cup live Sutton 0 Arsenal 2: Theo Walcott scores his 100th Gunners goal to add to Lucas Perez's opener at non-league side 'No class' Arsenal slammed after captain Theo Walcott embarrassingly forgets to exchange pennant with Sutton skipper ahead of FA Cup clash Lor Welcome Arsenal to open talks with Napoli star Lorenzo Insigne after sending scouts to watch him in action PA:Press Association Ryan Giggs would love Gareth Bale to return to the Premier League but admits it won’t happen 
“While he’s happy there [Madrid], I can’t see him leaving.” 
The 27-year-old is winning the hearts of Madrid supporters after returning from injury with a bang against Espanyol. 
88 days after picking up an ankle injury against Sporting Lisbon in November, Bale took just 12 minutes to find the net that sealed a 2-0 win.
